title: Rowlett police investigating shooting death of 12-year-old
content:
Last night, Rowlett police and fire responded to a shooting in the 3400 block of Beech Street.
The 9-1-1 call came from a woman who said her 12-year-old son was shot.
The child was transported to Baylor Scott & White Medical Center-Lake Pointe where he was pronounced dead.
The incident occured at 10:38 p.m.
Rowlett PD spokesman, Det. Cruz Hernandez, said the mother of the child left the house to run an errand and when she returned she found her son with a gun shot wound and called police.
Hernandez said not many details can be released because it is an ongoing investigation.
The child's name can't be released because he is a minor.
Police are still investigating whether a crime occurred or if it was self-inflicted or accidental. They are also waiting on a preliminary report from the Dallas County Medical Examiners office.
Check back for updates as they become available.
